abbreviation for volatile organic compound: a type of compound (= a chemical that combines two or more elements) containing carbon that changes easily into a gas and that can be harmful to people's health or to the environment: They are studying cancer risks near all busy roads where elevated VOC (volatile organic compounds) levels are likely. VOCs react with sunlight to produce ground-level ozone, which can irreparably harm lung function.
More examplesFewer examplesThe attorney said his clients were concerned about "significant VOC emissions" that will be carried over Baytown.We used recycled wood for cabinets and low VOC (volatile organic compounds) paints.The team will be investigating several methods to reduce dust, ammonia, and VOCs.
